webwork-tex.statement:
%mbx script removed problem header Consider a car whose position, \(s\), is given by the table \par \begin{center}
\par\smallskip\begin{center}\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|} \hline
\(t\) (s) &0 &0.2 &0.4 &0.6 &0.8 &1 \\ \hline
\(s\) (ft) &0 &0.5 &1.8 &3.8 &6.5 &9.6 \\ \hline
\end {tabular}\end{center}\par\smallskip
\end{center}
\par Find the average velocity over the interval \(0 \le t \le 0.2\). \leavevmode\\\relax average velocity = \mbox{\parbox[t]{4ex}{\hrulefill}} help (units) \par Estimate the velocity at \(t=0.2\). \leavevmode\\\relax velocity = \mbox{\parbox[t]{4ex}{\hrulefill}} help (units)
\par \par {\bf Solution: }\par SOLUTION \par The average velocity over the interval \(0 \le t \le 0.2\) is given by
\par \(\frac{s(0.2)-s(0)}{0.2}=\frac{0.5}{0.2}=2.5\) ft/s.
\par The average velocity over the interval \(0.2 \le t \le 0.4\) is given by
\par \(\frac{s(0.4)-s(0.2)}{0.2}=\frac{1.8-0.5}{0.2}=6.5\) ft/s.
\par
A reasonable estimate for the velocity at \(t=0.2\) is the average \(\frac{1}{2}\cdot (2.5+6.5) = 4.5\) ft/s.
\par
